sub_title: Software Developer, Interviewer & Leader | Mobile experience since 2008 | Guinness World Record 2013 Beatbox Ensemble
summary:
Electrical engineer by education, software developer by passion, analytical and pragmatic problem solver with good balance between leadership, commercial focus and technical breath and depth.

I strive to lead by example and try to inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more – by entrusting them autonomy, and helping them achieve mastery and find purpose.

Highlights:
● Established and grew mobile web within Booking.com
Initially responsible for technical breakthroughs (eg: UserAgent detection and showing mobile site without losing conversion on redirects) resulting in turning mobile website full-on. Latter responsible for growing mobile web team, on-boarding people and spinning off several multidisciplinary teams (designers, copywriters and front-end and back-end developers).

● Experienced technical and fit interviewer
Technical evaluation of 700+ candidates for back-end and front-end developers and team leads, some native Android and iOS developers. Recently switched into mostly doing non-technical (fit) interviews.

awards.title: Beatboxing Guinness World Record
awards.description:
One of 4,695 participants that made the largest human beatbox ensemble - achieved by employees of Booking.com at RAI Amsterdam, Netherlands, on 10 December 2013.

http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/largest-human-beatbox-ensemble

profile_positions.description:
Leading a team that is cross platform: mobile and desktop; and cross funnel: from landing pages, throughout research and conversion including post purchase.

Focusing on consumer psychology - bringing together technology, data, design and copy-writing to entice visitors to become customers.

Involved hands-on in coding as well as interviewing and on-boarding, mentoring and coaching.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Developer & Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Leading a team that is cross platform: mobile and desktop; and cross funnel: from landing pages, throughout research and conversion including post purchase.

Focusing on consumer psychology - bringing together technology, data, design and copy-writing to entice visitors to become customers.

Involved hands-on in coding as well as interviewing and on-boarding, mentoring and coaching.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead - Consumer Psychology (Persuasion)

profile_positions.description:
Originally leading team of 4. Besides continuing to code - I've on-boarded, mentored, coached and grew team members, worked with PO on prioritizing backlog, and acted as Scrum Master.

Remained involved hands-on – focused on “infrastructure” changes that drastically improve performance (and conversion rate) and enable new functionality across web platforms (mobile and desktop).

At times team would grow up to 8-10 people before splitting into two - each time bringing more focus on specific (sub)area of the business.

Team(s) brought up conversion rate to % that's practically unheard off on mobile, meanwhile number of reservations grew roughly two orders of magnitude.

http://seekingalpha.com/article/3402635-the-priceline-groups-pcln-ceo-darren-huston-on-q2-2015-results-earnings-call-transcript:
"Web-based mobile is a highly converting big base of transactions for us and it ends up - in the hotel space, transactions are relatively infrequent, so a pretty significant percentage happens on web-based, particularly customers we’ve never seen before." 

"What are the other things we can do to innovate to get more out of core search and we’ve seen some benefit particularly in mobile web, where we work together to try to get more out of mobile web, and that’s been, I think, very successful."

During this time I've evaluated 500+ candidates on phone and F2F interviews for developer positions - mostly backend, some frontend and mobile apps (Android and iOS) as well.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead - Mobile Website

profile_positions.description:
Part of team that established mobile web withing Booking.com - paving the way for other teams.

At the time industry was split between https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2012/04/why-we-shouldnt-make-separate-mobile-websites/ and those recommending redirects from desktop to mobile sites.

Personal achievements/highlights:
● implemented initial device detection (user-agent parsing) in order to identify device types on the fly and run A/B experiment(s) to show website content suited to specific device
● identified reasons of considerable drop in conversion for customers getting mobile site (eg: bounce/drop-off on redirect)
● devised concept of rewriting/adapting requests internally without redirects as solution for both drop in conversion, and keeping same domain and URL (eg: SEO, URL sharing, bookmarks)

Strategy we came up with is similar to what's now called adaptive http://www.sitepoint.com/moving-beyond-responsive-web-adaptive-web/
profile_positions.title: Developer - Mobile Website

profile_positions.description:
Member of XML team that's taking care of communication towards hotels (eg: Hilton, Marriot), affiliates (eg: Google, Trivago), and integration of mobile applications.

Improved error handling and logging – allowing account managers to independently help partners for majority of complaints and questions.

Phone interviews of candidates and on-boarding, mentoring and coaching new hires - XML team was one of starter teams with big throughput of on-boarders.
profile_positions.title: Developer - XML team

profile_positions.description: Freelance consultant to numerous clients - mostly web development using Perl, MySQL, table-less XHTML, CSS and JS/AJAX.
profile_positions.title: Owner - Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for design and implementation of new service - HLR lookup, including writing technical documentation specifying public HTTPS API interface.

Maintained and improved:
● SMS gateway serving 1000's of clients with permanent connections sending 100K-1M SMS per day (SMPP, SS7, HTTP and Bulk File Upload APIs)
● SMS clients connecting Routo to ~100 SMS providers and GSM operators (SMPP, SS7, EMI/UCP, HTTP and DNS APIs)

I've introduced formal development process with SVN for code storage and deployment and WiKi for documentation - as result of development team growing.

Mentoring and coaching junior (PHP) developers. Backup sysadmin in on-call rotation maintaining Slackware and Gentoo servers running Apache, PostgreSQL, MySQL and in house developed SMS servers and clients.
profile_positions.title: Systems Developer (Consultant)

profile_positions.description: Developed EMI/UCP protocol implementation as independent Perl module and client on top of it - interfaced with the rest of existing system on one end, and large SMS providers (hardware SMSC) on the other.
profile_positions.title: Consultant
